example.reasoning: 1\*2 + 2\*3 = 8;                   2\*2 + 3\*4 = 16;                   1\*1 + 2\*4 = 9;                   2\*1 + 4\*4 = 18                    Example 2:        input: A = [[1,2],                    [2,4]],                B = [[2,1],                    [3,4],                    [4,5]]        output: -1        reasoning: the length of the rows of A does not equal          the column length of B

title: Matrix times Matrix

pytorch_test_cases.test:
import torch
res = matrixmul(
    torch.tensor([[1,2],[3,4]]),
    torch.tensor([[1,0],[0,1]])
)
print(res.numpy().tolist())

import torch
res = matrixmul(
    torch.tensor([[1,2,3],[2,4,5],[6,8,9]]),
    torch.tensor([[1,2],[3,4],[5,6]])
)
print(res.numpy().tolist())

import torch
res = matrixmul(
    torch.tensor([[1,2,3],[2,4,5]]),
    torch.tensor([[1,2],[3,4]])
)
print(res.numpy().tolist())

description_decoded: multiply two matrices together (return -1 if shapes of matrix don't align), i.e. $C = A \cdot B$
